page.title: 16GROWTH OF A PULHAM COTTAGE
page.content: This whitewashed timberframed cottage, over 300yrs old,consisted of 2 large living rooms,spiral staircase from kitchen area to 2 upper rooms,thatched roof,exposed beams & walls of wattle & daub.Deeds date from 1807 when the copyhold was given to the occupier.In 1920 the kitchen & staircase were removed,inglenook filled in,2 alcoves added using old timbers & a new kitchen & staircase leading to toilet & bathroom added.Later came a septic tank & electricity.In 1971 the present owner installed oil-fired central heating & doubleglazing,opened the chimney inglenook,added a library extension, downstairs shower room & toilet.The conservatory was restored & 2 vines planted.The 4 acre garden & moat have been landscaped & the outbuildings removed or restored to enhance the attractive appearance.
